Posts tagged with Hugo Winners

  • 12 December 2024

    The Futility of Hoping, But Like, Funny and With Monks

    In a time when post-apocalyptic fiction is having a bit of a moment, A Canticle for Leibowitz still holds its own even sixty-five years after it was first published. Its message might not be a very heartening one, but luckily these hapless monks bring some much-needed levity, too.

This website is a playground, to mess around with writing and web design. For right now, though, it really is just a dime-in-a-dozen blog.
